intro: Hibbertia hemignosta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has narrow, linear leaves. Hibbertia hemignosta is a shrub that can reach up to 1 meter in height, with hairy stems and small, oval-shaped leaves. It is often found in regions of New South Wales and Victoria.
